__tnt.metering.init.push(function(){

    lastDate = lastDate.getTime();
    
    if(Number(lastDate)<Number(expireDate)){

        var nextDate = new Date(expireDate+(__tnt.metering.config.days * 86400000));

});

    var recent = __tnt.recent.assets.get();
    var uuid = __tnt.metering.config.uuid;
    
    var check = false;
    var i = 0;
    while(!check && i < recent.length){
        if(recent[i]==uuid){
            __tnt.log("found asset in recent");
            var check = true;

    var cleanedReferrer = String(String(window.document.referrer).split('?')[0]).replace(/https\:\/\/|http\:\/\//,'').replace(/www/,'');
    var check = false;
    
    $.each(sites,function(){
        var regexp = String(this).replace(/\./g,'\\.').replace(/\,/g,'|');
    
        if(String(cleanedReferrer).search(regexp)>-1){
            __tnt.log("User arrived from site, entry granted");
        
            check = true;
        }else{
        	__tnt.log("User arrived from other site, no special access");
        }
    });
    
    __tnt.metering.config.referred = check;
    return check;
});
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){

        }else{

            }

});
// increment counter on new assets
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){

__tnt.metering.access.d.push(function(){

        .after('<div class="subscription-required"></div>');

    if(remaining < 0){remaining = 0;}

__tnt.metering.compatibility = function(){
    var compatible = true;
    var status = "";
    
    /* this checks for compatibility with DOM storage */
    try{
        window.sessionStorage.setItem('__tnt.compatibility',true);
    }catch(e){

    };
    if(!compatible){

};
var bloxHasSubscription = false;
            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            /* if service not whitelisted check user service */
            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5594);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4597);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4598);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4600);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://poststar.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });


    </script>

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>GREENWICH -- The state Department of Health has certified the two days of clean test results and have lifted the boil water alert for the village of Greenwich.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Residents may use water without boiling it.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1420333"></div></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/poststar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>The boil-water order was a result of waterline work being done in the village.</p></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1420330"></div></div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://poststar.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=4768c6fa-5611-11e4-ab7b-db44b2cb8dd7&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://poststar.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=4768c6fa-5611-11e4-ab7b-db44b2cb8dd7&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != '4768c6fa-5611-11e4-ab7b-db44b2cb8dd7') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://poststar.com/tncms/block/1421721/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

<p><strong>UPDATE:</strong> Officials with the Stansbury Park Improvement District said Thursday around 5 p.m. that water samples had been tested and that the water in the area is safe to drink.</p>
<p>STANSBURY PARK, Utah - Officials are warning those in Stansbury Park to boil their water before drinking it.</p>
<p>The district said five and nine water samples tested positive for coliform bacteria.</p>
<p><fb:post data-width="552" href="https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=830639616975775&id=113807565325654"></fb:post></p>
<p>Coliforms are present in the environment and usually not harmful.</p>
<p>However, the presence of the bacteria in drinking water may mean the water is contaminated with disease-causing organisms.</p>
<p>king water could mean the water is contaminated with disease-causing organisms.</p>
<p>The district said it will collect 15 additional samples to confirm if the bacteria is in the water.</p>
<p>Officials said the district chlorinated the reservoirs overnight and flushed hydrants Wednesday in an effort to disinfect the system.</p>
</div>

<!-- Schema.org Tags --> <div itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/NewsArticle"> <meta content="News " itemprop="articleSection"/> <meta content="Brainerd,MN 56401" itemprop="dateline"/> <meta content="<p>A request for Brainerd Public Utilities (BPU) to reimburse expenses incurred during the recent water boil order has been shot down.</p><p>It was denied by the League of Minnesota Cities (LMC), on behalf of the city, because the city did not act negligently, according to the letter from LMC.</p><p>The Brainerd School District first wrote to BPU, asking if there was any way to be reimbursed for the $10,000 the district spent in supplying bottled water to students and staff during the boil order.</p><p>Steve Lund, director of business services for the district, said the district will now have to reach into the reserve fund to pay the $10,000 fee, as well as another $500 for coach buses (for bathroom use) and another several hundred dollars for portable toilets (district leaders haven't received the invoice yet).</p><p>According to the letter written to the school district by the claims adjuster with the League of Minnesota Cities, "the city of Brainerd has not acted negligently and that it has satisfied its duty to exercise ordinary and reasonable care in the operation of its water distribution system. Accordingly, I do not believe the city of Brainerd is responsible for the expenses the school district incurred to purchase bottled water and will be unable to offer a settlement of your claim."</p><p>The school district's request is the only one of its kind BPU has received, said BPU Superintendent Scott Magnuson. He doesn't expect any more to come through.</p>" itemprop="articleBody"/> <span itemprop="headline"> <meta content="School District water boil order reimbursement request denied" itemprop="headline"/>         </script>
</div><h1 class="node-title">School District water boil order reimbursement request denied</h1>
<div class="node-byline">
<span class="node-byline-author">By <a href="/users/jessie-perrine-0">Jessie Perrine</a></span>
<span class="node-byline-time"> on Oct 16, 2014  at 10:11 p.m.</span>
<!--Share buttons-->
<div id="sticky-anchor"></div>
<div class="node-share-buttons" id="sticky">
<div class="addthis_sharing_toolbox"></div>
</div>
</div><div class="node-body"><p>A request for Brainerd Public Utilities (BPU) to reimburse expenses incurred during the recent water boil order has been shot down.</p></div><div class="node-body"><p>It was denied by the League of Minnesota Cities (LMC), on behalf of the city, because the city did not act negligently, according to the letter from LMC.</p></div><div class="mobile-ad" id="second-mobile-ad">
<script type="text/javascript">
          googletag.cmd.push(function() {
            googletag.display('second-mobile-ad');
          });
        </script>
</div> <script type="text/javascript">
        // Google Consumer Survey
        (function () {
            var ARTICLE_URL = window.location.href;
            var CONTENT_ID = 'everything';
            document.write(
                    '<scr' + 'ipt ' +
                    'src="//survey.g.doubleclick.net/survey?site=_ukbxjywdri6cuoztsc44qdmqyq' +
                    '&url=' + encodeURIComponent(ARTICLE_URL) +
                    (CONTENT_ID ? '&cid=' + encodeURIComponent(CONTENT_ID) : '') +

    </script>
<div class="p402_premium"><div class="node-body"><p>The Brainerd School District first wrote to BPU, asking if there was any way to be reimbursed for the $10,000 the district spent in supplying bottled water to students and staff during the boil order.</p><p>Steve Lund, director of business services for the district, said the district will now have to reach into the reserve fund to pay the $10,000 fee, as well as another $500 for coach buses (for bathroom use) and another several hundred dollars for portable toilets (district leaders haven't received the invoice yet).</p><div class="jobsHQ-hotjobs-single" id="jobsHQ-hotjobs-single-0"></div><p>According to the letter written to the school district by the claims adjuster with the League of Minnesota Cities, "the city of Brainerd has not acted negligently and that it has satisfied its duty to exercise ordinary and reasonable care in the operation of its water distribution system. Accordingly, I do not believe the city of Brainerd is responsible for the expenses the school district incurred to purchase bottled water and will be unable to offer a settlement of your claim."</p><p>The school district's request is the only one of its kind BPU has received, said BPU Superintendent Scott Magnuson. He doesn't expect any more to come through.</p></div><div style="clear:both;"></div></div><script type="text/javascript">try {_402_Show();} catch (e) {}</script>

<!-- Schema.org Tags --> <div itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/NewsArticle"> <meta content="News " itemprop="articleSection"/> <meta content="Brainerd,MN 56401" itemprop="dateline"/> <meta content="<p>A request for Brainerd Public Utilities (BPU) to reimburse expenses incurred during the recent water boil order has been shot down.</p><p>It was denied by the League of Minnesota Cities (LMC), on behalf of the city, because the city did not act negligently, according to the letter from LMC.</p><p>The Brainerd School District first wrote to BPU, asking if there was any way to be reimbursed for the $10,000 the district spent in supplying bottled water to students and staff during the boil order.</p><p>Steve Lund, director of business services for the district, said the district will now have to reach into the reserve fund to pay the $10,000 fee, as well as another $500 for coach buses (for bathroom use) and another several hundred dollars for portable toilets (district leaders haven't received the invoice yet).</p><p>According to the letter written to the school district by the claims adjuster with the League of Minnesota Cities, "the city of Brainerd has not acted negligently and that it has satisfied its duty to exercise ordinary and reasonable care in the operation of its water distribution system. Accordingly, I do not believe the city of Brainerd is responsible for the expenses the school district incurred to purchase bottled water and will be unable to offer a settlement of your claim."</p><p>The school district's request is the only one of its kind BPU has received, said BPU Superintendent Scott Magnuson. He doesn't expect any more to come through.</p>" itemprop="articleBody"/> <span itemprop="headline"> <meta content="School District water boil order reimbursement request denied" itemprop="headline"/> <meta content="Jessie Perrine" itemprop="author"/> <div itemprop="publisher" itemscope="" itemtype="https://schema.org/Organization"> <div itemprop="logo" itemscope="" </div><h1 class="node-title">School District water boil order reimbursement request denied</h1>
<div class="node-byline">
<span class="node-byline-author">By <a href="/users/jessie-perrine-0">Jessie Perrine</a></span>
<span class="node-byline-time"> on Oct 16, 2014  at 10:11 p.m.</span>
<!--Share buttons-->
<div id="sticky-anchor"></div>
<div class="node-share-buttons" id="sticky">
<div class="addthis_sharing_toolbox"></div>
</div>
</div><div class="node-body"><p>A request for Brainerd Public Utilities (BPU) to reimburse expenses incurred during the recent water boil order has been shot down.</p></div><div class="node-body"><p>It was denied by the League of Minnesota Cities (LMC), on behalf of the city, because the city did not act negligently, according to the letter from LMC.</p></div><div class="mobile-ad" id="second-mobile-ad">
<script type="text/javascript">
          googletag.cmd.push(function() {
            googletag.display('second-mobile-ad');
          });
        </script>
</div> <script type="text/javascript">

<div class="p402_premium"><div class="node-body"><p>The Brainerd School District first wrote to BPU, asking if there was any way to be reimbursed for the $10,000 the district spent in supplying bottled water to students and staff during the boil order.</p><p>Steve Lund, director of business services for the district, said the district will now have to reach into the reserve fund to pay the $10,000 fee, as well as another $500 for coach buses (for bathroom use) and another several hundred dollars for portable toilets (district leaders haven't received the invoice yet).</p><div class="jobsHQ-hotjobs-single" id="jobsHQ-hotjobs-single-0"></div><p>According to the letter written to the school district by the claims adjuster with the League of Minnesota Cities, "the city of Brainerd has not acted negligently and that it has satisfied its duty to exercise ordinary and reasonable care in the operation of its water distribution system. Accordingly, I do not believe the city of Brainerd is responsible for the expenses the school district incurred to purchase bottled water and will be unable to offer a settlement of your claim."</p><p>The school district's request is the only one of its kind BPU has received, said BPU Superintendent Scott Magnuson. He doesn't expect any more to come through.</p></div><div style="clear:both;"></div></div><script type="text/javascript">try {_402_Show();} catch (e) {}</script>

Yorktown announced Tuesday afternoon.</p><p class="speakable-p-2 p-text">EARLIER: Because of a a water main break during the installation of new gas main along Pinehurst Road in the Woodland Trail Subdivision, residents in the area should boil all water for consumption, the town of Yorktown announced Thursday afternoon.</p><p class="p-text">Water is fine for washing hands, clothes, cooking etc, but direct ingestion should be avoided until further notice.</p><p class="p-text"><span>Affected residents include those at addresses 305-800 Pinehurst and all located in Oakmont Circle. Natural Dam Residents Asked To Boil Water

Thursday
Oct 16, 2014 at 9:10 AM

The Arkansas Department of Health has issued a boil water notice for customers in the Natural Dam area of the Cedarville Waterworks, according to a news release.

The Arkansas Department of Health has issued a boil water notice for customers in the Natural Dam area of the Cedarville Waterworks, according to a news release.


The order was issued because of a water main break. The order was issued as a precautionary measure because of the possibility that contaminated water may have entered the distribution system as a result of partial loss in normal system pressure.


Under the order, all affected customers are advised the water may be unsafe for human use, the release states. Users should briskly boil all water for drinking and food preparation for one minute prior to use. Ice cubes should be discarded and only boiled water used for making ice.


The order will remain in effect until the problem has been corrected and bacterial tests show the water is safe to drink, the release states.

<div class="trb_sc" data-role="sc_information sc_container" data-sc-c="page" data-sc-cont="story" data-sc-contid="81673935" data-sc-desc="HOWEY-IN-THE-HILLS — It's safe to drink the town's water. <h1 class="trb_ar_hl_t" itemprop="headline">Boil-water order lifted in Howey-in-the-Hills </h1>
</div>
</header>
<div class="trb_ar_main">
<div><div class="trb_ar_by"><figure class="trb_ar_by_i_f"><img alt="Jerry Fallstrom" class="trb_ar_by_i" height="70" src="http://www.trbimg.com/img-53c7fc15/turbine/os-jerry-fallstrom-bio-20140716/70/70x70" srcset="http://www.trbimg.com/img-53c7fc15/turbine/os-jerry-fallstrom-bio-20140716/140/140x140 2x, http://www.trbimg.com/img-53c7fc15/turbine/os-jerry-fallstrom-bio-20140716/210/210x210 3x" title="Jerry Fallstrom" width="70"/></figure><span class="trb_ar_by_nm_pm"><span class="trb_ar_by_nm_au" data-byline-withoutby=""><a class="trb_ar_by_nm_au_a" href="/os-jerry-fallstrom-bio-20140716-staff.html#nt=byline" itemprop="author">Jerry Fallstrom</a></span><span class="trb_ar_by_b"></span><a class="trb_ar_by_cl" data-role="sc_sEmail" href='mailto:jfallstrom@orlandosentinel.com?subject=Regarding: "Boil-water order lifted in Howey-in-the-Hills"'>Contact Reporter</a><span class="trb_ar_by_nm_pb">Orlando Sentinel</span></span></div><div class="trb_ar_sl">
<a class="trb_ar_sl_it" data-role="sc_information sc_container" data-sc-c="shareline" data-sc-cont="story" data-sc-contid="81673935" data-sc-desc="Residents of tiny Howey-in-the-Hills are advised to boil their water." data-sc-nn="Orlando Sentinel" data-sc-sl="os-lk-howey-boil-water-notice-20141014" data-sc-th="http://www.trbimg.com/img-544164d9/turbine/os-lk-howey-boil-water-notice-20141014" data-sc-ti="Boil-water order lifted in Howey-in-the-Hills" data-sc-url="/news/lake/os-lk-howey-boil-water-notice-20141014-story.html"><span class="trb_ar_sl_it_item" data-role="sc_share" data-sc-t="facebook"><svg class="trb_sc_item_svg"><use xlink:href="#trb_facebook"></use></svg></span><span class="trb_ar_sl_it_item" data-role="sc_share" data-sc-t="twitter"><svg class="trb_sc_item_svg"><use xlink:href="#trb_twitter"></use></svg></span></a><div class="trb_ar_sl_t">Residents of tiny Howey-in-the-Hills are advised to boil their water.</div></div><div class="trb_nls_c" data-nls-options="esp=cm&sn=article&listid=2105794108&newsletterEndpointUrl=https://api.nlr.tronc.com/v3/newsletters/subscriptions&newsletterApiKey=t2RIwsHk5p8RFZ0sPKLEr2M0Rh64DNz69BDRyGQa&grecaptchaSiteKey=6Le1uQoUAAAAAJlmu5Oue58PyhPzc_ZLYtR7AzKt&aid=2089072590&allurl=http://membership.orlandosentinel.com/newsletters" data-nls-successmsg="Thanks for signing up!" data-role="nls"><div class="trb_nls_h" data-nls-header="Get the free Sentinel Insight newsletter, a twice-weekly glimpse of different points of view on issues in the news."></div><form class="trb_nls_f" data-role="nls_form"><input autocomplete="on" class="trb_nls_e" data-role="nls_email delayload delayload_done" name="email" placeholder="Enter your email" required="" type="email"/><input class="trb_nls_s" data-role="nls_submit" type="submit" value="Sign up"/></form><a class="trb_nls_p" href="http://www.tribpub.com/privacy-policy-and-your-privacy-rights/" rel="noopener" target="_BLANK">Privacy Policy</a></div>
<div class="trb_ar_dateline"><time class="trb_ar_dateline_time" data-dt="October 17, 2014, 2:09 PM" datetime="2014-10-17T14:09:00EDT" itemprop="datePublished"></time>
</div>
</div>
<div class="trb_ar_bd" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="trb_ar_page" data-content-page="1" data-role="pagination_page">
<p>HOWEY-IN-THE-HILLS — It's safe to drink the town's water.</p><p>A boil-water order that was imposed on Tuesday has been lifted after a second state-required test came back clear, town officials said today.</p><div class="trb_gptAd trb_ar_main_ad" data-adloader-adtype="articlebottomcube" data-adloader-label="" data-adloader-position="articleCube" data-adloader-size="300x250" data-role="adloader adloader_ad delayload delayload_done" data-state="adloader_unloaded" data-withinviewport-options="bottomOffset=100&topOffset=1000000"></div><p>"The satisfactory completion of the bacteriological testing was done showing that the water is safe to drink," reads a notice on the town's website, howey.org. Town workers are leaving notices to that effect on residents' doors.</p><p>The boil order came about after the water system's automatic control system malfunctioned and caused a loss in water pressure. The state Department of Environmental Protection requires two days of clear tests before a boil order can be lifted, Mayor Chris Sears said.</p><div class="trb_ar_cont" data-ar-cont="Article continues below"><svg class="trb_ar_cont_svg"><use xlink:href="#trb_thin_arrow_down"></use></svg></div>
<aside class="trb_ar_sponsoredmod" data-adloader-networktype="yieldmo" data-load-method="trb.vendor.yieldmo.init" data-load-type="method" data-role="delayload delayload_item" data-screen-size="mobile" data-v-ymid="ym_1220254225348066454" data-withinviewport-options="bottomOffset=100&topOffset=1000000">
</aside>
<aside class="trb_ar_sponsoredmod" data-adloader-networktype="nativo" data-load-method="trb.vendor.nativo.init" data-load-type="method" data-role="delayload" data-v-ntidd="1069529" data-withinviewport-options="bottomOffset=100"><div class="trb_ar_nt"></div></aside><p>Sears said a software issue caused the malfunction and resulting loss in a loss of water pressure, which is required at a certain level to keep bacteria out of water lines.</p><p>"I think it was just one of those things," Sears said. "We've got it taken care of."</p><p><em><a href="mailto:jfallstrom@tribune.com">jfallstrom@tribune.com</a> or 352-742-5916</em></p></div>
</div>

<script>
        __tnt.trackEvent = function(obj) {
            if( jQuery.type(obj) === 'object' ){
                
                    
                        
                        if(obj.category && obj.action){
                            __tnt.googleEvent(obj);
                        } else if(obj.network && obj.socialAction){
                            __tnt.googleSocial(obj);
                        } else {
                            __tnt.googlePageView(obj);
                        }
                    if(typeof TNCMS.Tracking != 'undefined' && obj.metric){
                        TNCMS.Tracking.addEvent({
                            app: obj.app,
                            metric: obj.metric,
                            id: obj.uuid
                        });
                    }
                
            }
        }
        
        if(__tnt.trackEventLater.length > 0){
            jQuery(__tnt.trackEventLater).each(function(){
                __tnt.trackEvent($(this));
            });
        }
        jQuery('body').on(__tnt.client.clickEvent, '[data-track]', function(){
            var trkObj = jQuery(this).data('track');
            __tnt.trackEvent(trkObj);
        });
        jQuery('body').on(__tnt.client.clickEvent, '[data-tncms-track-event]', function(){
            var trkObj = jQuery(this).data('tncms-track-event');
            __tnt.trackEvent(trkObj);
        });
        jQuery('body').on(__tnt.client.clickEvent, '[data-tncms-track-dmp]', function(){
            var dmpData = jQuery(this).data('tncms-track-dmp');
            	_cc10028.add('act', + dmpData);
	_cc10028.bcp();
});
    </script>

<script src="https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/harrisondaily.com/shared-content/art/tncms/templates/libraries/flex/components/plugins/resources/scripts/jquery.calendario.7b513d925fce875220017f8d5a8055a0.js"></script>
<script>/*<![CDATA[*/ jQuery(document).ready(function($){
        var aChecked = [],
            urlParams = '/search/?l=25&unrolled=1&s=start_time&sd=asc&f=html',

            $wrapper = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-inner' ),
            $calendar = $( '#calendar-1484449' ),
            cal = $calendar.calendario({
                displayWeekAbbr: true,
                startIn: 0,
                onDayClick: function( $el, $contentEl, dateProperties ) {
                    window.location = $('#block-1484449 .url-template').attr('href') + urlParams + '&d1=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date') + '&d2=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date');
                }
            }),
            $month = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-month' ).html( cal.getMonthName() ),
            $year = $( '#block-1484449 .fc-year' ).html( cal.getYear() );


        $('#block-1484449 .fc-next').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoNextMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        $('#block-1484449 .fc-prev').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoPreviousMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        function updateMonthYear(){
            $month.html(cal.getMonthName());
            $year.html(cal.getYear());
            fetchDays();
        }
        function fetchDays(){
            if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                $.ajax({
                    type: 'GET',
                    dataType: 'json',
                    url: $('#block-1484449 .url-template').attr('href') + '/search/?year='+cal.getYear()+'&month='+cal.getMonth()+'&fmt=json',
                    cache: true,
                    success: function(data) {
                        $.each(data, function(index, value){
                            if(value.result.numEvents > 0){
                                sMonth = value.result.month.toString();
                                if(sMonth.length < 2){ sMonth = '0'+sMonth }
                                sDay = value.result.day.toString();
                                if(sDay.length < 2){ sDay = '0'+sDay }
                                sString = sMonth + '-' + sDay + '-' + value.result.year;

                                oNumEvents = {};

                                var iOneDot = 1,
                                    iTwoDots = 2,
                                    iThreeDots = 3;

                                oNumEvents[sString] = '<div class="fc-data-item">';
                                if( value.result.numEvents > 0 && value.result.numEvents < iOneDot+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> ';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iOneDot && value.result.numEvents < iTwoDots+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iTwoDots ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }
                                oNumEvents[sString] += '</div>';

                                cal.setData(oNumEvents);
                            }
                        });

                        if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                            aChecked.push(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth());
                        }
                    },
                    error: function(response) {
                        __tnt.log(response.status);
                    }
                });
            }
        }
        fetchDays();
    }); /*]]>*/</script>
